questions.question: I show up with a smile when you feel good inside.
I make you shiver and wear a jacket.
I purr, chase mice, and love to nap in the sun.
I'm faster than walking; you do me in races.
I light up the day and keep the Earth warm.
I'm a color, like the sky or the ocean.
I'm round and fun to kick, throw, or bounce.
I go up off the ground with both feet.
You do this with food, three times a day.
You sit on me to rest your legs. I have four legs.
I have pages and words — you read me for fun or facts.
I'm white, cold, and come from cows.
I have roots, a trunk, and leaves — I give shade.
I curve your lips upward when you're happy.
I face danger without fear — like a firefighter or hero.
I show care and help others feel good.
I come with joy, often with a big sound.
You do this to a ball or falling object with your hands.
You do this with blocks or bricks to make something tall.
You do this with soap and water to get clean.
I go up a ladder, tree, or mountain.
I move quickly, like a cheetah or a race car.
I can burn, boil, or melt — opposite of cold.
I bark, wag my tail, and love bones.
A heavy feeling after making a mistake.
You do this with your brain when solving a puzzle.
A feeling that something might not be true or right.
To find an answer to a problem or puzzle.
Something not told to everyone.
Speaking so softly that words cannot be understood.
Choosing not to pay attention to someone or something.
Moving without a clear direction or purpose.
Walking in a slow, relaxed way.
To stop briefly.
Free from agitation or strong emotion.
A strong harsh feeling caused by pain or unfairness.
To strongly say something again and again until accepted.
Saying that someone is guilty of a wrong action.
A very quick look.
Full of danger or chances of something going wrong.
A risk that can hurt you.
To bring something new into existence.
A heavy feeling after making a mistake.
Something not told to everyone.

Choosing not to pay attention to someone or something.
Moving without a clear direction or purpose.
Walking in a slow, relaxed way.
To strongly say something again and again until accepted.
Saying that someone is guilty of a wrong action.
A very quick look.
Suddenly seeing something you didn’t see before.
A very quick look.
To inspect broadly or get an overview.
Full of danger or chances of something going wrong.
A risk that can hurt you.
A sudden rush of fear that makes clear thinking hard.
Helping someone escape from danger.
Getting out of trouble or a trap.
Fixing something that is broken.
To guard or support against attack or harm.
Freedom from danger or risk.
To find an answer to a problem or puzzle.
A systematic way of doing something.
A logical basis for a belief or action.
To remove defects or problems (in code or systems).
To bring something new into existence.
To design or make something that did not exist before.
A rough drawing capturing the main ideas.
To work together to produce creative results (short form).
A source of artistic inspiration.
A small but powerful trigger for an idea.
